subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Monday, 14 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Pearce sacked as Man City manager
Man City sack manager Stuart Pearce after two years in charge of the club.



 
Jewell resigns as Wigan manager
Boss Paul Jewell leaves Wigan less than 24 hours after saving the club from relegation on the final day of the Premiership season.



 
Wigan name Hutchings as new boss
Wigan chairman Dave Whelan appoints Chris Hutchings as the club's new manager following Paul Jewell's resignation.








GOLF




Mickelson earns Sawgrass victory
Phil Mickelson wins The Players Championship by two strokes from Sergio Garcia.



 
Hudson pleased despite collapse
England's Rebecca Hudson is happy to move a step closer to a place at the British Open despite throwing away victory at the Spanish Open.



 
Pettersen wins maiden LPGA title
Norway's Suzann Pettersen overcomes South Korea's Jee Young Lee in a play-off at Michelob Ultra Open.








MOTORSPORT




Ferrari concerned by reliability
Ferrari boss Jean Todt fears lack of reliability may undermine his team's dual title challenge this year.



 
Ecclestone cool on Imola return
Formula One boss Bernie Ecclestone says the San Marino Grand Prix is unlikely to be back on the calendar next year.



 
I can win the F1 title - Hamilton
Lewis Hamilton says he is in a "strong position" to win the Formula One title in his first season.








FORMULA ONE




Ferrari concerned by reliability
Ferrari boss Jean Todt fears lack of reliability may undermine his team's dual title challenge this year.



 
Ecclestone cool on Imola return
Formula One boss Bernie Ecclestone says the San Marino Grand Prix is unlikely to be back on the calendar next year.



 
I can win the F1 title - Hamilton
Lewis Hamilton says he is in a "strong position" to win the Formula One title in his first season.








ATHLETICS




Sprint stars set for Loughborough
Three of the British squad that won the Olympic 4x100m gold in 2004 will compete at the Loughborough International on Sunday.



 
Cheruiyot storms to Glasgow win
Vivian Cheruiyot wins the women's 10 kilometres road race in Glasgow.



 
Legendary running track reopens
A £19m sports complex is opened at the historic site where Roger Bannister broke the four-minute mile.








CYCLING




Petacchi hits back with stage win
Alessandro Petacchi wins the third stage of the Giro d'Italia while compatriot Enrico Gasparotto regains the overall lead.



 
Hoy sets new world best over 500m
Chris Hoy misses out on the kilometre world record in Bolivia but sets a new mark over 500m.



 
Cavendish sprints to points win
Mark Cavendish grabs his second stage win in the Four Days of Dunkirk race to claim the overall points jersey.








FUN AND GAMES




Comment: Rough justice for Blades
Robbo says West Ham should have been relegated 



 
Review of the week
Freddy Shepherd offers to "carry Michael Owen to Liverpool"



 
Holloway column
"Maybe Blair could be the next manager of Newcastle, if he can take the pressure"
